info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 13 at 3:41PM MDT until September 13 at 4:15PM MDT by NWS Grand Junction CO
info.description:
At 341 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain over the Elk Burn Scar. Between 0.3 and 0.6 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.1 to 0.2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly.
Excessive rainfall over the warning area will cause mud slides near steep terrain. The mud slide can consist of rock, mud, vegetation and other loose materials.
HAZARD...Flash flooding and debris flow caused by thunderstorms in and around the Elk Burn Scar.
SOURCE...Radar.
IMPACT...Flooding of areas in and around the Elk Burn Scar.
Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Areas near Highway 8 where debris flows have been reported by law enforcement.
This includes the following streams and drainages... North Elk Creek, Cottonwood Creek, Miller Creek, Coal Creek, White River, Lone Tree Creek, Big Beaver Creek, Dry Creek, Little Beaver Creek and East Beaver Creek.
info.instruction:
Mud flow have been reported along State Highway 8. Roads and driveways may be washed away in places. If you encounter flood waters...climb to safety.
Move away from recently burned areas. Flooding of creeks, roads and normally dry arroyos is likely. The heavy rains will likely trigger rockslides, mudslides and debris flows in steep terrain, especially in and around these areas.

parameter.value: FLASH FLOOD WARNING FOR THE ELK BURN SCAR REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR CENTRAL RIO BLANCO COUNTY
